_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:15:55 using v2.2
title: What other antibiotics are most prescribed?
analysis_commentary: This graph shows the use of other antibacterial groups (excluding penicillins and groups with less than 100,000 items dispensed in 2013) and we see an increase in use for most types. The exception is cephalosporins where the use has suddenly declined since 2007. This sudden decline is likely to be linked (https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/clostridium-difficile-infection-how-to-deal-with-the-problem) with the numerous initiatives aiming to reduce the use of cephalosporins as an effective control measure for the incidence of clostridium difficile infection among hospital patients.
data_source: Health and Social Care Information Centre, Prescriptions Dispensed in the Community
